abstract: Labor groups have a complicated relationship with Wall Street: they capitalize on populist anger against banks, and yet the unions represent a huge bloc of shareholders.
snippet: Labor groups have a complicated relationship with Wall Street: they capitalize on populist anger against banks, and yet the unions represent a huge bloc of shareholders.
lead_paragraph: When the city of Los Angeles started looking into its complex financial contracts with banks earlier this year, some council members turned to an unusual corner for financial advice: labor unions.

headline.main: Unions Make Strides as They Attack Banks

byline.original: By Steven Greenhouse and Louise Story

abstract: Unions have criticized Wall Street before. But their attacks have taken on a new shape, both in ferocity and style, over the last 18 months, ever since the federal government doled out billions of dollars in bank bailouts. Labor leaders say the fortunes of banks and unions are linked more than people realize.

abstract: Bank of America is eager to expand in China, the bank’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, said Wednesday, Reuters reported.
snippet: Bank of America is eager to expand in China, the bank’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, said Wednesday, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America is eager to expand in China, the bank’s chief executive, Brian T. Moynihan, said on Wednesday, Reuters reported.

headline.main: BofA Looking to Expand in China, Chief Says
